WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: There's this big guy (that's how you remember the radical, remember?), and he's wearing a huge Tie Dye (ãŸã„, ã ã„) shirt. Because he's so huge, the tie dye shirt is also super huge. Everything about him is pretty big, but the tie dye stands out more than anything.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: When you look at the big guy in your head, imagine him covered in tie dye head to toe. Think about how ridiculous it looks on him, especially since he's such a big guy. Shirt. Sweatpants. Hat. Shoes... it goes on and on.

origin_of_ch_char_book: (ä¸€, yi, One) influenced its philosophical meaning to establish (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, heaven). This character is a combination of â€œa big manâ€ (å¤§, da, big) and the one and only and higher (ä¸€, yi, one). In other words, it expresses something higher than the highest person. The common person or man is expressed as bending his waist like this: (äºº, ren, human). When expressed as (å¤§, da, big), it means someone more powerful than a common man. Therefore, (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, heaven) means someone higher than the big man, the one and only being, that is the God who lives in Heaven. Therefore, this letter is currently being used as a meaning for Heaven, Day, or God.,The King connects Heaven and Earth. The trinity of Heaven, Earth and Human is also reflected in the character which means king: (ç‹, wang, king). The three horizontal lines mean sky, human and earth, and the vertical line means the connection of the three elements each other. So this word is interpreted as the person who connects heaven and earth, the holy king. On the other hand, I think this character depicts a big man () wearing something like a flat hat (), who is standing on a flat platform () and with his arms and legs spread widely, ordering others. Ancient East Asian civilizations were discovered in the North Eastern area of China. Sculptures of ancient kings (or Shamans) unearthed at these archaeological sites show that they wore headdresses which were flat. The meaning of the flat shape could be to show that this person is â€œ a big man who can connect Heaven and Earth and Human.â€ In ancient China, the king thought to himself as the center of the world. (å¤®, yang, middle) consists of the king å¤§ (da, big), and the H-shaped symbol that means from border to border. Putting these symbols together, we can see the symbol means the king who reigns over the whole land. This king had a variety of decorations on his head to show he was something special.,The king wearing the crown also treasured jade, which was considered even more valuable than gold in East Asia. (é»ƒ, é»„, huang, yellow) depicts a man of high position (å¤§, da, big) standing proudly and wearing a decoration around his waist . In those times, the man in high positions wore a waist decoration carved in jade.,During the times when Chinese characters were being invented, the shamans or kings wore headdresses decorated with animal horns or feathers. When they were dressed in elaborate headdresses and luxurious clothes, they personified the word â€œbeautyâ€ themselves. This is the origin of the character (ç¾, mei, beautiful). A big person (å¤§, da, big) is wearing a sheepâ€™s horn (ç¾Š, yang, sheep) in this character. It describes a King standing proudly wearing a headdress of sheepâ€™s horn. On the other hand, because the sheep means Godâ€™s righteousness, the character can also mean â€˜the man of God â€“ the Kingâ€™.,A person who is of higher rank and proud is expressed in a front view (å¤§, da, big) without bowing to others. (å¤«, fu, husband) is a man wearing his hair in a knot. Because the married man tied up his hair with a rod-like hairpin, this character now means a husband. But the first time this character was made, it meant a nobleman who had been promoted and who stood with dignity.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The " big " character is like a person standing frontally with his arms drooping. The original meaning is an adult, as opposed to the " zi " elephant child (the " zi " elephant child is dancing with his arms to play). Because he is older than the child, the extension has great meaning. See " child ".

Jin Wen means big, as opposed to " small ", Xi Zhong: "Big Zhong Ba Yu (4)". Also used as a name. It is also read throughout as " Tai ", such as "Da (Tai) History" (historical official), "Da (Tai) Bao" (official name, Auxiliary Minister), "Da (Tai) Room" (Tai Miao Middle Room), "Da (Tai) Division" (official name) and so on.

The ancient characters " big " and " husband " are the differentiation of the word. The word " big " originally meant both husband (adult man) and big (the relative meaning of adult and child has a great meaning). Later, the word " husband " was formed by adding a short horizontal line to " big ". Scholars think that a dash is a meaningless pen.

" Big " is also used as " Bo ", "Said Wen. "Big Bud": "Big, big sky, big earth, big people. So the elephant is in the form of human beings. The ancient prose is also the same." "Said Wen. "Qi Bu": "Qi, Yanwen is big, changed to ancient prose. It also looks like a human form." Duan Yucai's note: "The big cloud is the ancient Wen Zi, and the Yunxiewen is big. This is the mutual interpretation of ancient texts. Ming is only one character. Slightly different."
humanum_short_description_en: " Big " is like an adult, the original meaning is an adult (as opposed to a child), and it is extended to be big.

origin_of_ch_char_book: (ä¸€, yi, One) influenced its philosophical meaning to establish (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, heaven). This character is a combination of â€œa big manâ€ (å¤§, da, big) and the one and only and higher (ä¸€, yi, one). In other words, it expresses something higher than the highest person. The common person or man is expressed as bending his waist like this: (äºº, ren, human). When expressed as (å¤§, da, big), it means someone more powerful than a common man. Therefore, (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, heaven) means someone higher than the big man, the one and only being, that is the God who lives in Heaven. Therefore, this letter is currently being used as a meaning for Heaven, Day, or God.,The King connects Heaven and Earth. The trinity of Heaven, Earth and Human is also reflected in the character which means king: (ç‹, wang, king). The three horizontal lines mean sky, human and earth, and the vertical line means the connection of the three elements each other. So this word is interpreted as the person who connects heaven and earth, the holy king. On the other hand, I think this character depicts a big man () wearing something like a flat hat (), who is standing on a flat platform () and with his arms and legs spread widely, ordering others. Ancient East Asian civilizations were discovered in the North Eastern area of China. Sculptures of ancient kings (or Shamans) unearthed at these archaeological sites show that they wore headdresses which were flat. The meaning of the flat shape could be to show that this person is â€œ a big man who can connect Heaven and Earth and Human.â€ In ancient China, the king thought to himself as the center of the world. (å¤®, yang, middle) consists of the king å¤§ (da, big), and the H-shaped symbol that means from border to border. Putting these symbols together, we can see the symbol means the king who reigns over the whole land. This king had a variety of decorations on his head to show he was something special.,The king wearing the crown also treasured jade, which was considered even more valuable than gold in East Asia. (é»ƒ, é»„, huang, yellow) depicts a man of high position (å¤§, da, big) standing proudly and wearing a decoration around his waist . In those times, the man in high positions wore a waist decoration carved in jade.,During the times when Chinese characters were being invented, the shamans or kings wore headdresses decorated with animal horns or feathers. When they were dressed in elaborate headdresses and luxurious clothes, they personified the word â€œbeautyâ€ themselves. This is the origin of the character (ç¾, mei, beautiful). A big person (å¤§, da, big) is wearing a sheepâ€™s horn (ç¾Š, yang, sheep) in this character. It describes a King standing proudly wearing a headdress of sheepâ€™s horn. On the other hand, because the sheep means Godâ€™s righteousness, the character can also mean â€˜the man of God â€“ the Kingâ€™.,A person who is of higher rank and proud is expressed in a front view (å¤§, da, big) without bowing to others. (å¤«, fu, husband) is a man wearing his hair in a knot. Because the married man tied up his hair with a rod-like hairpin, this character now means a husband. But the first time this character was made, it meant a nobleman who had been promoted and who stood with dignity.

Elaboration: The" big" character is like a person standing frontally with his arms drooping. The original meaning is an adult, as opposed to the " zi" elephant child (the " zi" elephant child is dancing with his arms to play). Because he is older than the child, the extension has great meaning. See " child". Jin Wen means big, as opposed to " small", Xi Zhong: "Big Zhong Ba Yu (4)". Also used as a name. It is also read throughout as " Tai", such as "Da (Tai) History" (historical official), "Da (Tai) Bao" (official name, Auxiliary Minister), "Da (Tai) Room" (Tai Miao Middle Room), "Da (Tai) Division" (official name) and so on. The ancient characters " big" and " husband" are the differentiation of the word. The word " big" originally meant both husband (adult man) and big (the relative meaning of adult and child has a great meaning). Later, the word " husband" was formed by adding a short horizontal line to " big". Scholars think that a dash is a meaningless pen. " Big" is also used as " Bo", "Said Wen. "Big Bud": "Big, big sky, big earth, big people. So the elephant is in the form of human beings. The ancient prose is also the same." "Said Wen. "Qi Bu": "Qi, Yanwen is big, changed to ancient prose. It also looks like a human form." Duan Yucai's note: "The big cloud is the ancient Wen Zi, and the Yunxiewen is big. This is the mutual interpretation of ancient texts. Ming is only one character. Slightly different."

So, if you know the radical, you know the meaning of this kanji as well.
